title: Noam Chomsky: 2013-02-24 Radio Interview
description:
Noam Chomsky is interviewed by U.S.S. Liberty survivor Phil Tourney on the 02-24-2013 RBN "Your Voice Counts" radio show.  

The USS Liberty was a United States Navy technical research ship, that was attacked by Israeli Air Force jet fighter aircraft and Israeli Navy motor torpedo boats, on 8 June 1967, during the Six-Day War.

The program begins with a summary recounting of the USS Liberty incident by Phil Tourney, an eye witness and survivor of the attack.  Mr. Tourney then discusses the incident with Noam Chomsky and the program concludes with call-in questions from  listeners.  Other topics discussed include the recent Chuck Hagel US Defense Secretary nomination hearings, as well as various aspects of US involvement in the middle east. This recording is an edited version of the full radio program.

For additional information regarding the attack on the U.S.S. Liberty, as well as a list of sources discussing the event see the Wikipedia article at:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Liberty_incident
